bonuses.leadin: Shen Buhai was likely instrumental in enacting the ideas of this philosophical school. For 10 points each:

parts: Identify this Asian school of political philosophy which ignored morality in favor of security and order. Like Daoism, this school emphasizes Wu wei, or non-action, an idea it applies in relation to the head of a government.

answers: great white shark [accept Carcharodon carcharias; begrudgingly accept white death or white pointer]
Greenland shark [or gurry shark or grey shark; accept Somniosus microcephalus; accept eqalussuaq] <DM/CL>
parts: This shark species is the largest living fish species, and its members use filter pads and gill slits for filter feeding. This species is the only member of the genus Rhincodon.

This perhaps most famous shark species is named for the color of its underbelly and has sharp triangular teeth. This species is responsible for more recorded attacks on humans than any other shark species.

This elusive shark species is thought to have the longest lifespan of any vertebrate and lives in deep waters. The Icelandic culinary dish kaestur hakarl is usually made using members of this species.

bonuses.leadin: This quantity is equal for both axes of the indifference curve. For 10 points each:
answers: diamonds and water [accept in either order; prompt on partial]
parts: Name this economic concept which describes the amount of satisfaction gained by a customer from a good, as expressed by personal preferences.

These two goods provide one name for the “paradox of value,” in which the one with a seemingly greater utility has a lower value because it is widespread. The concept of marginal utility resolves that paradox about these goods.
The paradox of value presented by diamonds and water was described by this Scottish thinker in An Inquiry into the Nature and Causes of the Wealth of Nations.

bonuses.leadin: For 10 points each, name some things about the Paleocene-Eocene Temperature Maximum, or PETM.
answers: global warming [accept climate change; accept word forms and equivalents]
parts: Parallels have been drawn between the PETM and the modern day due to this phenomenon widely accepted to be in part the result of human activity releasing carbon dioxide.
During the PETM, levels of this isotope of carbon in seafloor bacteria dropped dramatically. This isotope has seven neutrons.
The PETM was also marked by an increase in the population of members of this phylum, which likely resulted from secondary endosymbiosis with red algae. They include zooxanthellae.

This third party nominated James B. Weaver in 1892, who won five western states. This party advocated for the rights of farmers and urban workers.

The Populists held their first convention in 1892, where they wrote this platform. It declared “every dollar taken from industry without an equivalent is robbery” and called for direct election of Senators and graduated income tax.

bonuses.leadin: This ionic compound is widely found in South American salt flats. For 10 points each:
answers: sodium nitrate [accept nitratine or nitratite or soda niter]
parts: Name this salt with formula NaNO3 (“N A N O 3”). It is also known as Chile saltpeter.
Sodium nitrate reacts with a salt of this metal in a double-replacement reaction to form regular saltpeter, which is this metal’s nitrate.
Saltpeter is combined with charcoal and sulfur to form this substance also known as black powder, which is explosive. This substance was invented in China and used in firearms.
